com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.identifier.stateid

Interface StateIds

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DocumentIdentifiers, IndexingIdentifiers, Iterable<StateId>, QueryIdentifiers
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractStateIds, StateId, StateIdsBuilder

    public interface StateIds
extends DocumentIdentifiers, Iterable<StateId>
    A representation of a set of state ids. A state id identifies a set of documents within a stored state in IDOL. A stored state is primarily identified by an opaque string known as a state token but a state id can also include a zero-based range of indices that restrict the state id to a subset of the documents in the stored state. e.g. TOKEN[3-6]. Such ranges are represented by the StateRange class.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • append

        StateIds append(String stateToken,
                int document)
        Combines the state ids in this with the specified state id and zero-based document index.

        It is implementation specific whether or not this is modified or whether a new object is returned instead. If this is modified it should also be returned.

        Parameters:
        stateToken - The state token to append
        document - The document index for the state token
        Returns:
        The combined state ids object

      • append

        StateIds append(Iterable<?>... stateIds)
        Combines the state ids in this with the specified state ids. The Iterable can contain instances of String or StateId. Note that all instances of StateIds are suitable iterables.

        It is implementation specific whether or not this is modified or whether a new object is returned instead. If this is modified it should also be returned.

        Parameters:
        stateIds - The state ids to append
        Returns:
        The combined state ids object
